Learn what we've been up to this past year and our plan moving forward into the future.

Aloha ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The end of 2019 is here! Close out the year with us at our Annual Membership Meeting, which is taking place on Wednesday, December 11 at the Neal S. Blaisdell Center's Maui Room. This free, public event focuses on the affiliate's civil rights work from this past year and our plan moving forward into the future. We will also be celebrating the 228th anniversary of the ratification of the Bill of Rights!

2019 Annual Membership Meeting

This free, public event focuses on our civil rights work in 2019 and what to look forward to in 2020.

Wednesday, December 11, 5:30 p.m.
Blaisdell Center, Maui Room
777 Ward Ave
Honolulu, HI 96814

Please note: This link will take you to a third-party website, eventbrite.com
RSVP TODAY

Preceded by a brief business meeting, the annual membership meeting will feature updates from staff members on key issues the affiliate worked on this year in litigation, advocacy, and public education, such as houselessness, education justice, the right to protest, gender equity, abortion rights and more. The meeting will also include a special presentation regarding the ACLU's Campaign for Smart Justice Hawai'i, which aims to address systemic racial inequalities in the criminal legal system while reducing incarceration rates by 50 percent, centering the voices of impacted community members.

2019 was a big year for us. We're excited to share our work with our members and the public, and to get your feedback and thoughts so we can continue to work toward a better, more just Hawai'i.

The Blaisdell Center is ADA-accessible. For more information, or to request special accommodation at the gathering: email office@acluhawaii.org, or call the ACLU event hotline at 808-522-5906. Neighbor islanders call toll free: 1-877-544-5906. Light refreshments will be served.

Mahalo and we hope to see you on Wednesday!

ACLU of Hawai'i
